info.name: Business Messaging API
info.description:
A Postman collection of CM's Business Messaging API.


Official API documentation: https://docs.cmtelecom.com/en/api/business-messaging-api/1.0/index/

item.name: send a message, without worring about multipart or encoding

request.description:
This API enables you to send text messages to mobile phones all around the world in very high volume.
The Messaging Gateway API covers the interface between your application and the CM Platform by means of the HTTP protocol. 
Only bulk (free of charge for the end user) text messages are supported.

item.name: send a message, with a custom grouping

request.description:
This API enables you to send text messages to mobile phones all around the world in very high volume.
The Messaging Gateway API covers the interface between your application and the CM Platform by means of the HTTP protocol. 
Only bulk (free of charge for the end user) text messages are supported.

item.name: send a message to multiple recipients, without worring about multipart or encoding

request.description:
This API enables you to send text messages to mobile phones all around the world in very high volume.
The Messaging Gateway API covers the interface between your application and the CM Platform by means of the HTTP protocol. 
Only bulk (free of charge for the end user) text messages are supported.
Send a message, which can become a multipart or unicode message
REMEMBER TO OPEN CUSTOMER CARE WINDOW FIRST !
REMEMBER TO OPEN CUSTOMER CARE WINDOW FIRST !
REMEMBER TO OPEN CUSTOMER CARE WINDOW FIRST !
REMEMBER TO OPEN CUSTOMER CARE WINDOW FIRST !

item.name: plain text message with SMS fallback

request.description: REMEMBER TO OPEN CUSTOMER CARE WINDOW FIRST !

item.name: Sending Viber text, media and button

request.description: Please note that sending a message containing only media and a button will be rejected by Viber

item.name: mo-webhooks
item.description:
Our incoming message webhooks, also known as inbound messages or MO (Mobile Oriented) messages.

Configure your application server as the request URL and send these messages to your server to emulate incoming message from our server

- message keys are case-insensitive
-
